what mime mime stands multipurpose internet mail extensions the standard send multipart multimedia binary data using the world wide internet email system typical uses mime include sending images audio wordprocessing documents programs even plain text files important mail system modify part of file mime also allows labelling message parts recipient mail program may determine how read mime message since mime years old still mailers use which understand mime messages however growing number mail programs mime support built in one popular mime capable mailer unix vms pcs pine developed the university washington available via anonymous ftp host ftp cac washington edu file pine pine tar in addition several proprietary email systems provide mime translation capability internet gateway products however even do not access mime capable mailer suitable gateway is still hope there number stand alone programs interpret mime message one versatile called munpack developed at carnegie mellon university available via anonymous ftp the host ftp andrew cmu edu directory pub mpack versions available unix pc mac amiga systems compabibility with older forms transferring binary files munpack program also decode messages split uuencoded format does mime replace uuencode yes uuencode used time encoding binary files so that sent via internet mail several technical limitations interoperability problems mime uses robust encoding called base64 carefully designed survive the message transformations made certain email gateways how learn mime the mime internet standard described rfc 1521 available via anonymous ftp many different internet hosts including us east coast address ds internic net 198 49 45 10 us west coast address ftp isi edu 128 0 32 pacific rim address munnari oz au 128 250 21 europe address nic nordu net 192 36 148 17 look file rfc rfc1521 txt another source information internet news group comp mail mime which includes periodic posting frequently asked
